title: 3,500 years of shellfish farming by indigenous peoples on the Northwest coast

title_detail.value: 3,500 years of shellfish farming by indigenous peoples on the Northwest coast

summary: The indigenous peoples of British Columbia have been harvesting shellfish from specially-constructed clam gardens for at least 3,500 years, according to a new study. This research offers new methods for tracking the history and development of mariculture.

summary_detail.value: The indigenous peoples of British Columbia have been harvesting shellfish from specially-constructed clam gardens for at least 3,500 years, according to a new study. This research offers new methods for tracking the history and development of mariculture.
